snippet: Senator Charles E. Grassley, Republican of Iowa, wants to examine the university’s loans to faculty and executives, but a university representative said the scrutiny was unfair.
abstract: Sen Charles E Grassley, Republican of Iowa, wants to examine New York University's executive compensation practices, specifically loans to faculty and executives, but insists  university is not forthcoming and has yet to provide crucial information requested; university holds that it has complied, that all categories of information have been provided, and that scrutiny is unfair.
lead_paragraph: Senator Charles E. Grassley, Republican of Iowa, wants to examine the university’s loans to faculty and executives, but a university representative said the scrutiny was unfair.

headline.main: N.Y.U. Impeding Compensation Inquiry, Senator Says
headline.print_headline: N.Y.U. Impeding Compensation Inquiry, Senator Says
